intro: Coelachyrum yemenicum, commonly known as Yemen starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. Coelachyrum yemenicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
